abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings illustrate the success
            of the project, i.e., highly satisfactory project outcome,
            highly likely sustainability, and high institutional
            development impacts, including a highly satisfactory Bank
            performance, and satisfactory borrower performance.
            Regardless of success, valuable lessons suggest the
            following. Concerns during appraisal focused on the
            financing of new acquisitions, liable to mismanagement
            because of the weak parastatal organization, and,
            alternatives presented included draining the lake, thus
            abandoning the infrastructure, an alternative which would
            have resulted in much higher economic and social costs in
            the long run, while electricity production from thermal, and
            other sources, were considerably more expensive. This led
            the Bank to approve the project, but required the inclusion
            of an institutional upgrading requisite, in the form of
            sector restructuring, and management development, in
            addition to strict adherence to a financial restructuring
            plan, and compliance with covenant financial ratios,
            measures which proved essential for the final success. The
            intended project focus was primarily on the critical need to
            repair, and rehabilitate the dam, however, the intense, and
            decisive dialogues on sector reform, and its enforcement -
            if needed - by means of disbursements suspension, resulted
            in not only a timely completion of the physical
            infrastructure, but in meeting as well the project's
            institutional objective, that of resolving the operational
            and financial management of the sector's principal
            operator. And, the successful transfer of electricity, and
            water supply services to private management came through a
            sequence of institutional reforms.
